info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 3:18AM CDT until June 12 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN SHERMAN...SOUTHEASTERN DALLAM...MOORE AND NORTHEASTERN HARTLEY COUNTIES... At 317 AM CDT, automated weather equipment reported a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles north of Hartley, or 10 miles southeast of Dalhart, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Automated weather equipment and trained spotters. At 310 AM CDT, automated weather equipment recorded a 72 mph wind gust at the Dalhart Airport. Additionally, trained spotters reported half dollar size hail occurred between 312 and 317 AM CDT in Dalhart. IMPACT...Expect some tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Dumas, Dalhart, Hartley, Cactus, Sunray, Four Way and Masterson. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
